name: Enchiladas de Suelo
description: These enchiladas are a typical dish from the northern Mexican state of Sinaloa. They are open-faced, meaning they are not rolled, but instead the fillings are piled on top. They are filled with vegan chorizo, and veggies then topped with a smoky chile ancho sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the queso fresco: Press tofu for 30 min. Crumble tofu into a bowl and add the salt, nutritional yeast, lime juice, and garlic powder. Using your hand mix well. Let sit overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the queso fresco: Press tofu for 30 min. Crumble tofu into a bowl and add the salt, nutritional yeast, lime juice, and garlic powder. Using your hand mix well. Let sit overnight.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the sauce: bring a medium pot, filled with water, to a boil. Add zucchini and let cook for 2-3 minutes or until it’s slightly tender. Remove the zucchini with a strainer, and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the sauce: bring a medium pot, filled with water, to a boil. Add zucchini and let cook for 2-3 minutes or until it’s slightly tender. Remove the zucchini with a strainer, and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In the same boiling water drop the chiles and simmer slowly for 7 minutes. Strain the chiles, but save 1.5 cups of the chile water.
recipeInstructions.name: In the same boiling water drop the chiles and simmer slowly for 7 minutes. Strain the chiles, but save 1.5 cups of the chile water.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the soaked chiles, onion, garlic, cumin, oregano, white vinegar, and chile water in the blender. Process until smooth. Season to taste with salt. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the soaked chiles, onion, garlic, cumin, oregano, white vinegar, and chile water in the blender. Process until smooth. Season to taste with salt. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the enchiladas: heat a large sauté pan to medium heat and add the chorizo, cook stirring often for 4-5 minutes until the chorizo is golden brown. Remove the chorizo from the pan and set it aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the enchiladas: heat a large sauté pan to medium heat and add the chorizo, cook stirring often for 4-5 minutes until the chorizo is golden brown. Remove the chorizo from the pan and set it aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the pan you cooked the chorizo in, to low heat, and pour in the enchilada sauce. Bring to a simmer and turn off.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the pan you cooked the chorizo in, to low heat, and pour in the enchilada sauce. Bring to a simmer and turn off.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the vegetable oil in a separate sauté pan to 350°F. Dip one of the tortillas in the enchilada sauce, make sure both sides are covered in sauce. Take this tortilla and drop it in the oil. Almost immediately flip the tortilla, then quickly remove it from the oil. Place it on the plate. (You must do this quickly or the tortilla will get soggy and fall apart). Repeat this process with the rest of the tortillas.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the vegetable oil in a separate sauté pan to 350°F. Dip one of the tortillas in the enchilada sauce, make sure both sides are covered in sauce. Take this tortilla and drop it in the oil. Almost immediately flip the tortilla, then quickly remove it from the oil. Place it on the plate. (You must do this quickly or the tortilla will get soggy and fall apart). Repeat this process with the rest of the tortillas.

recipeInstructions.text: To assemble the enchiladas: top the tortillas with the chorizo, add the cooked zucchini, shredded, lettuce, sliced radishes, queso fresco, and avocado. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: To assemble the enchiladas: top the tortillas with the chorizo, add the cooked zucchini, shredded, lettuce, sliced radishes, queso fresco, and avocado. Serve immediately.

keywords: avocado salsa, easy enchiladas, vegan chorizo
